flavorText: Blessed with many options, Thornscape masters favor scarabs as familiars.

foreignData.flavorText: Obwohl sie mit vielen Möglichkeiten gesegnet sind, bevorzugen Meister des Donnerpfads Skarabäen als Vertraute.
foreignData.name: Vertrauter des Dornenpfads
foreignData.text: Rote und weiße Zaubersprüche, die Du spielst, kosten {1} weniger.

foreignData.flavorText: Bien qu'ils aient l'embarras du choix, la plupart des maîtres spinosophes choisissent un scarabée comme familier.
foreignData.name: Familier spinosophe
foreignData.text: Les sorts rouges et les sorts blancs que vous jouez coûtent {1} de moins à jouer.

name: Thornscape Familiar
originalText: Red spells and white spells you play cost o1 less to play.

rulings.text: If a spell is both red and white, you pay {1} less, not {2} less.

The generic X cost is still considered generic even if there is a requirement that a specific color be used for it. For example, “only black mana can be spent this way”. This distinction is important for effects which reduce the generic portion of a spell’s cost.
This can lower the cost to zero, but not below zero.
The lower cost is not optional like with some other cost reducers.
Can never affect the colored part of the cost.
If this card is sacrificed to pay part of a spell’s cost, the cost reduction still applies.

text: Red spells and white spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
